website_summaries.verdict: A nice small impact drill with a lot of power.
pros: Small size with a lot of power
Three setting modes can be changed quickly
Three LED lights make working in dark spaces much easier

customer_reviews.title: Can't handle hard work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this impact driver less than 2 years ago and it definitely cannot handle an everyday workload like I require. I am a builder who uses my impact driver everyday, and this tool does not live up to my needs. I have all Dewalt cordless tools (hammer drill, 6.5" circular saw, grinder, multi tool, sawsall) and they work great, but the impact driver has had trigger issues right off the bat, as well as quick bit change issues, and most importantly driving issues. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS TOOL to any hard working builder or professional who depends on it to get their job done.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor G. Ives

customer_reviews.title: Beware!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned Dewalt tools for years and wanted to upgrade from my 18v impact driver. Big mistake....the DCF887B is no good! It shuts off while driving screws! Driving basic 3 inch screws it goes about half way in and shuts off, have to release the trigger and start again, will go a few more turns and same thing! This is when driving screws in basic 2 by lumber. I’m returning and going with the other 20v Dewalt impact model. It doesn’t have the safety shutoff!
customer_reviews.author: Kelli Coy

customer_reviews.title: Moves nuts and bolts, not as great for wood fasteners
customer_reviews.text: Setting 1 is worthless. It barely has the torque to put a 2" #8 screw into cedar and will frequently bog down before triggering it's own impact clutch. Settings 2 and 3 have crazy torque but are also impossible to precisely control. You can't drive screws into wood and expect controllable depth. Much more useful for manipulating nuts and bolts than screws. I wish that setting 1 was between 1 and 2 and that the impact clutch had adjustable torque.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Bagley

customer_reviews.title: Nasty!!!#Best Deal!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a sheet metal worker and I've been using dewalt 20v cordless tools for a long time now. I've had the regular 20v impact and let me say this 20v brushless XR is nasty!!!! It has so much more force and torque that I wasn't expecting and pounds large tek screws thru 1/4" plate lol!!!! It's smaller and the 3 speed is more handy than I would have thought, tough, and I'm loving it!!!! Best deal u can find from these guys 115$ for this bare tool!!
customer_reviews.author: Cmart

customer_reviews.title: Most versatile power tool that I own.
customer_reviews.text: I use this tool in the diesel shop almost daily. Too many uses to cover them all, but I have used this tool as a drill, nut driver, screwdriver, impact wrench, and die grinder. I use it mostly for removing hose clamps, screws, small bolts, easy outs, and drilling new holes for screws in dashboards and overheads. Get a nice selection of bits to get the most out of this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: No issues - DCF887B Made in the USA
customer_reviews.text: No issues with the tool. I bought this one to replace a DCF886 that I sold to a friend. These are awesome and so light when performing wheel changes on cars for maintenance or seasonal requirements! I even put it in my trunk in case I get a flat on a trip far from home. Note that the tool I purchased was the bare tool (DCF887B), and is stamped/stickered "Made in the USA with global materials". I don't know if Dewalt has multiple locations where they make these tools, as the one on amazon stated "Country of Origin: China".
customer_reviews.author: F. Glaude

customer_reviews.title: Great tool 6 Stars
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great instead of driving screws into wood this thing makes wood suck the screws in. So much power you haft to be careful. The 3 LED lights are excellent, and with battery attached the unit is still light and handy. I own the Kobalt 24v impact driver and it's not as powerful as the Dewalt, but it's more precise and better for sheetrock, but for wood this one is king. 6 Stars to Dewalt on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Normally love dewalt but this impact cuts off sporadically you have to let go of the trigger and re-engage it only does it on speed 3 there warranty policy isn't great unfortunately . Better off buying from a brick and mortar store at least you can return it and get a replacement immediately. Instead of having to go without it for who knows how long. I returned a battery weeks ago and still no word so I imagine it will be the same with the impact driver
customer_reviews.author: chris stephens

customer_reviews.title: This is an Absolutely amazing Impact Driver!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing, this puppy has an incredible amount of power and it comes equipped with 3 settings or modes that you can switch from 1, 2, and 3 at any moment depending on what you are working on. The 1st is a light duty setting or as Dewalt calls it Precision Drive 0-1000 RPM/ Mode 2 Normal Impacting 0-2800 RPM/ Mode 3 High Speed Impacting 0-3250 RPM, In other words this is a fantastic buy and you cannot go wrong with this driver it is also very compact which is perfect for tight fits! Love this tool 100%
customer_reviews.author: The Dukes Brew

customer_reviews.title: Strong as a tank!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is an absolute tank and is incredibly powerful for its small size. I’ve had mine for over three years now and I’ve beat the crap out of it and it still runs like new. The only thing that I would be aware of is that sometimes the speed selection switch at the bottom Can get debris stuck in it I can cause for not to go into the correct gear but it just needs to be cleaned out every now and then and it will work fine. Other than that one small fluke this thing is absolutely worth the Money!
customer_reviews.author: Alex Sledzik

customer_reviews.title: Not sure anymore
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 dewalt drivers and i noticed my newest drivers are failing faster than my oldest tools have. I have a driver like this one thats a little over a year old and my 4 year old driver is beating the hell out of it. The trigger switch is going out already and to replace it cost as much as a new one. I think quality is going south in my opinion. Its definitely frustrating when you have 10 batteries and other assesories and feel its time to change brands but it would be a large cost to do so. Frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Gadams

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic, amazing, how did I live without it tool!  Warning though...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic, amazing, how did I live without it tool! Has 3 variable speed and torque setting good for every job. I was able to go from torquing screws into wood with just the right pressure to easily removing rusted in rotor lock screws and even taking off lug nots on my car. Buy one today! Warning: Only buy the brushless mode! Much longer battery life and more power.
customer_reviews.author: Mikebib

customer_reviews.title: Dead after one year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one as a second. Worked fine for a while. Then it started to make a strange grinding noise in reverse. Now sparks fly out of it when the trigger is pulled. My five year old first unit still works fine. I don’t know what happened with this one. Died after one year of light use.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Emanuel

customer_reviews.title: Hot or cold, wet or dry
customer_reviews.text: There's a reason the pipeline folks in Alaska swear by Dewalt tools, they're very good! If you do your research and get each tool individually instead of in a package deal, you're going to get Dewalt's finest, newest equipment. This thing drives some pretty huge screws home into woods of all hardness; it simply works and it works well. It has three lights to give the whole area good lighting as well. I used this thing for hours on end fastening some furniture together and didn't get tired, nor did the battery, but ear protection is definitely preferable with that much constant use.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great, while it worked
customer_reviews.text: Great, while it worked. After about 5 minutes of use it went completely dead. Charged the battery just to make sure that's not the problem, but the trigger wouldn't even turn on the LEDs. The battery was brand new and powered other tools with no problem. I'm hoping it's an isolated manufacturing defect. I returned it and got another one, same model and from the same seller. So far the replacement is working fine.
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt impacts R getting worse & worse
customer_reviews.text: For the most part this is impact has been fine with one intermittent exception. The gun doesn't always work at full power so I have to kind of mess with the 3-speed switch at the base. That seems to be the source of why it doesn't always work at full power, and is very infuriating when you're in production mode trying to get a lot done. This is my second or third one of these (this model) and they all do the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: SOE CONTRACTING

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: This thing has power. But with power comes responsibility. Lol if you don’t have this like on the screw head and lined up straight you run the risk of stripping all of your screws. Also for some reason on setting one it only pushes a 2” #10 about half way and acts like the battery is dead. I don’t know if that is by design or not to “start” them
customer_reviews.author: j digital

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product as usual for Dewalt
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded my 18 volt unit to this 20 volt model with adjustable speed. I have used it for a month now and it is light, powerful, and versatile. I have used it as a screwdriver, a drill, and impact wrench and it can do all of these tasks. The LED light is a nice upgrade from my old unit. Dewalt products aren't cheap, but I already had several other 20 volt tools so I just bought the bare unit and used my existing batteries. I don't think you will be disappointed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Clasing

customer_reviews.title: DEFECTIVE
customer_reviews.text: Bought this drill on August 26th for a upcoming remodel on my home finnally went to use the drill today and it keeps shorting out like there is loose wiring inside and of course the return window closed 4 days ago. I have to bang the top of the drill each time I want to screw something in. Defective unit
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool overall
customer_reviews.text: Works well with nuts and bolts. Great power for the weight. For driving screws into wood, however, it just doesn't work well at all. Dies out before driving 2 1/2" screws into studs completely. Set it to 2 and bits started getting stuck in the drive guide. I'll try an impact ready drive guide next time, but I still think my 20V drill with clutch is far superior.
customer_reviews.author: VA

customer_reviews.title: Annoying
customer_reviews.text: Great Father's Day gift which you THINK is a home run until he opens it and asks "Where's the Charger?". $139 and you still need to buy a charger. Ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: C. Casey

customer_reviews.title: Good tool but....
customer_reviews.text: I wish if Dewalt find a better place for the reversible switch since it is placed near hand movement which caused me a big problem when I was using it to unscrew a bolt from the back which lead accidentally to touch the switch to forward instead of reverse without noticing which caused the bolt to tighten more instead of unscrewing which lead to breaking. It caused my car to sit for a few days on a jack till I received a new bolt from abroad for not being available here locally. I think it should be located in a place where you can not press it easily when moving tool in your hand.
customer_reviews.author: Saib A AL-Kohaji

customer_reviews.title: Extra long battery life with major torque......
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace one that had brushes in it thinking that I need the latest and best. This brush less one has twice the battery life and has three selectable speeds witch is nice. But over all there is not much difference between the two drivers as far as power and performance. I think that Dewalt has the best warranty and service and they will actually answer their phone and help you if you have a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Arizona kid

customer_reviews.title: Best tool ive ever bought
customer_reviews.text: First off I am only a homeowner I’m not a master craftsman I’m not even a journey craftsman I primarily own a home and bought it because I have a huge investment in my deck it’s tied to my house so I want to make sure that all the boards were tight I went out as soon as I bought it and a 2 inch nail went through a 2 x 4 like hot butter absolutely the first tool that I ever bought that work as advertised it’s amazing can’t wait to finish my deck.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Edelson-eubanks

customer_reviews.title: My previous drill was an 18V Black & Decker and I was fine using it for years
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast! I am very impressed with the torque and how little effort is required to operate. My previous drill was an 18V Black & Decker and I was fine using it for years. I use drills for hobby projects like wood working and scrapping old electronics. I finally convinced myself to buy a new drill, and am incredibly impressed with the results. The low profile lets me get into much tighter spaces then previously possible and even on the lowest setting I was able to take apart an old rusty treadmill with little to no effort on my part.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Great for 3/4” bolts and smaller
customer_reviews.text: I use this all the time for 3/4” and smaller and love it. Sometimes 3/4” bolts have to be broken loose by hand before this will take them out (the ones that are have to jump or hammer on tight) Really I’m reviewing the older model 1 speed brushed impact but so far I have had similarly the same experience though this is supposed to be better. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great driver. Very strong
customer_reviews.text: Great driver. Very strong. I just wish I had noticed mine didn’t come with a battery. Somewhat disappointing but I’ll let it go because I should have read the description better. Over all a great tool. But just check to see if yours comes with a battery. I think Dewalt could have included at least one. Just my 2 cents,
customer_reviews.author: jay

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool
customer_reviews.text: Bought this impact driver as new in box for a very competitive price. The tool has exceeded my expectations in every respect, totally blowing away my Dewalt 18v drill driver. My first project covered more than 1 day and the 5 amp hour battery I was using showed no need to recharge it when finished. I highly recommend this tool.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy! DeWalt from this seller has stopped working even after replacement twice!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product has failed me twice. The first time I got a replacement and this time I can't get any reply or resolution from the seller. So now I have an impact I paid over 120 dollars for that is junk!!!
customer_reviews.author: Holly M.

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE REPRESENTATION
customer_reviews.text: Not what was pictured or described at all. The drill was as beat up as they come and made a grinding noise! Also missing the belt hook when the description said it would come with one. Shipping was even delayed. Terrible buy!
customer_reviews.author: Grayson Lilly

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last
customer_reviews.text: This was our second Dewalt impact driver. The first one lasted about 3-1/2 years and we basically built a house with it, so figured it had done it's job. We replaced it with this new one and the new one lasted less than 5 months. At 4 months it started having trigger issues (which we had fixed on the first one as well) and then it overheated while driving a screw and quit working completely. We're deciding if it is worth it to try to get it repaired under warranty because shipping it could be cost prohibitive.
customer_reviews.author: Wynter

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding, built like a tank
customer_reviews.text: I love most of the Dealt 20V tools, but this is the one I use the most. I bought this as a backup to my other so if I need two swap bits, I can just use two drills and it something goes wrong, I have an extra. I've dropped this think from a 30 foot ladder onto rocks and it laughed at me and just kept working. Very impressed with these tools.
customer_reviews.author: CoBurnside

customer_reviews.title: This is awesome little gun I like the soft touch only setting ...
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome little gun I like the soft touch only setting number 1. But if you need a little bit more than that it takes a little getting used to using setting number 2.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best in the world
customer_reviews.text: These are great! We are setting lagbolts in roofs all day and it can handle the torque. These brushless drivers are my favorite. I'd say Dewalt and Milwaukee are my favorites. I've had problems with the chuck breaking (or whatever it's called that holds the adapter in) but that's really been the only issue. We are hard on our tools and they hold up pretty dang good.
customer_reviews.author: Mick G

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought it years ago.
customer_reviews.text: I've had the DeWalt 20v drill for several years and I should have got this then as well. It works great and I can't believe that you get this much impact torque out of this small tool and battery. I would suggest that you purchase some black impact drivers and not the silver socket adapters. This thing will just snap the silver ones off on anything over 10mm. I also really like the way they placed the lights on this unit.
customer_reviews.author: DusterP94

customer_reviews.title: Small but tough
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as part of a Dewalt promotion. At first I was skeptical of the small size, but it's excellent for driving or removing screws or tightening or loosening bolts. It's got a very high quality feel to it, and has both variable power levels as well as an easy-to-control speed trigger.
customer_reviews.author: Lowpad

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for recreational use
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine may of 2019 The good: incredible ergonomics, great light, great speed settings. The bad: not good for high demand work, went up in smoke. I used this impact for working on my cars, motorcycle ect and it was great. I started using it for work don't home renovations and started smoking badly shortly after so I retired it to personal use. I ended up switching over to milwaukee which I ended up really liking.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P.

customer_reviews.title: so my tools get beat up pretty hard. My old dewalt never let me down
customer_reviews.text: bought this to replace my 6 year old dewalt 20v impact. I am a professional technician for a high-line auto manufacturer, so my tools get beat up pretty hard. My old dewalt never let me down, and after a month of use with this one, I expect nothing more then the same great performance that i have come to expect from Dewalt. This impact is faster and hits harder then just about every other electric impact i have tested it against. I cannot tell you how happy i am with this and Dewalt in general.
customer_reviews.author: john otto

customer_reviews.title: Great driver
customer_reviews.text: This driver is great. It feels like a premium product and works flawlessly. Stop using a wired drill and extension cords for jobs that can be completed with a wireless driver. I am now much more likely to build things and tackle projects because of how easy this driver is to use.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Funny how the product dies 2 days after the return date , and all dewalt products lately !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: greg gonda

customer_reviews.title: Great impact!
customer_reviews.text: After 2 years of rough life, my old impact wouldn’t keep a bit chucked (they’d randomly fall out). Since the impact had been used hard and otherwise was flawless, I ordered another of the same model. New one is perfect. The 3 speeds are handy too because you can turn it down for delicate work or put it on 3 for driving home 3” deck screws all day
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I've abused this for several months now, starting with a home remodel. It drives structural screws with ease and battery life lasts for a long time. I'm an avid DIYer, not a pro. But I use my tools and don't baby them - so far this has been a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: The Max XR is a beast. Built incredibly well and not many projects need a whole lot more than this baby. Great value and great product.
customer_reviews.author: Connor Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Husband is happy!
customer_reviews.text: Husband wanted a DeWalt impact driver to replace one he used up. I ordered this one and a bundle deal one from Lowe's. Although they appear to be similar, this one has way more power. More power = happy husband. I returned the one from Lowe's (even though it had batteries, etc.).
customer_reviews.author: E2theC

customer_reviews.title: Great gets better.
customer_reviews.text: Dewalt improved the already brilliant 18v impact driver. The chuck is much easier to use one handed, the brushless motor runs much longer on the smaller batteries, making the overall weight of the driver even lighter. My old Dewalt impact driver is still going strong, but this one is improved in every way.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley Beach

customer_reviews.title: small and power full
customer_reviews.text: hands down, drwalt has done it again. all their tools are great, this one takes the cake, small but has a of power. the gentle man has said that was breaking adapters with his drill. i found that they are using low quality of metal in their bits and screws, they will go bad in a heart beat. some times with some screws and lag bolts i take my time with them. not made in the USA AND THAT IS A SHAME.
customer_reviews.author: gerald castron

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This driver is awesome. I have not found a screw I can't loosen or tighten with this thing. Tht three torque settings allow you to work on a wide range of jobs and projects. I'll never go back to a normal screw driver again.
customer_reviews.author: Drew SC

customer_reviews.title: A combo you can't go wrong with.
customer_reviews.text: Oh man oh man oh man the set I've been waiting for. Order it on thanksgiving day and got it Saturday. I put the impact on a small run and it is powerful and I mean powerful. The two batteries charged less then ten minutes a piece so their ready to play out the box. The tool Bag holds both tools batteries and dock plus the screw set with extra space.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Vallejo

customer_reviews.title: It's the Beast... worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: The beast.. replaces my hammer drill for 90% of applications... drives screws in treated wood like they were going through butter... but beware if the screws that are to thin it will just break them.... short screws don't seem to work eather, they strip out the wood...now this is all on the #2 setting. # 1 is to low for my app... never tried #3.. didn't need to so far But this bad boy gets the job done faster... and much lighter than my 996B dewalt hammer drill..
customer_reviews.author: z2d2dom

customer_reviews.title: Good product to buy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought my and I love the power and I know it heavy duty and I like Dewalt products.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT ALEXANDER

customer_reviews.title: One received was crap!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to remove bolts faster than a socket wrench. Couldn't break loose bolts that I easily did by hand/socket wrench. Then it quit working altogether. Pull the trigger, lights come on, but no rotation in either direction. Returning the item and ordered another one. Hopefully the new one will actually work!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Koppel

customer_reviews.title: RELIABLE
customer_reviews.text: Have had a brushless going on 6yrs and have no problems with it. For my use, batteries last a long time. I haven't an idea as to hrs of battery life. When they went on special, I bought me a 20V MAX XR and a 20V MAX impact driver. I can drill or drive nuts and bolts. VERSATILITY and DEPENDABILITY! Superb quality!!!
customer_reviews.author: Pablo

customer_reviews.title: You need to know that the Chuck is loose the tolerances are really badd
customer_reviews.text: I have the 885 and I bought the 887 why does the Chuck any 887 wobble so much the 885 does not do that
customer_reviews.author: Ricanron

customer_reviews.title: Battery last longer than expected
customer_reviews.text: I was doubtful that the battery would hold out but I drove over one hundred 3 inch deck screw the first time I used it and never thought about the batter. Has excellent power now. Let see how the torque holds up in the future as I use it more and more.
customer_reviews.author: John D Powell

customer_reviews.title: Came in Pre-opened and defective
customer_reviews.text: the box has been opened before and the battery connection looks defective. i'm guessing its been returned before for this issue.
customer_reviews.author: ATR

customer_reviews.title: plenty of power
customer_reviews.text: i put down deckboards for a 8x14 deck, 3 inch deck screws, with no problem, got the 4ah batteies and it did not even kill the battery did it all with one charge and still had power left, it would be nice if they actually gave you batteries and a bag but it's a good product, and that is coming from a terribly cynical preson.
customer_reviews.author: wizard

customer_reviews.title: Just a Spare
customer_reviews.text: DeWalt tools are awesome! I already have one of these and just wanted a spare for the camper. They are great for leveling jacks, and any other chore you have. Just changed the tires on my boat trailer using DeWalt's battery powered electric impact driver! GREAT
customer_reviews.author: PJDSR

customer_reviews.title: It’s good but not great
customer_reviews.text: I like the brushless motor sounds good and strong. Don’t like the adjuster for power level cheaply designed and Idk if I got the defective one or it’s the way it is. On the number one setting which is low torque almost like no power feels like it’s broken or something. Haven’t get a chance go to a supplier to verify it. Otherwise it’s a good tool. But I definitely would recommend a Milwaukee brushless impact. 18v but stronger than this.
customer_reviews.author: Daddy03

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tool!
customer_reviews.text: It's a total beast of a tool. I found the trigger a bit weird feeling compared to my non-brushless tools, but it really works well. I really struggled to pick this over the Milwaukee M12 Fuel, but I think I like the 20v platform better and I was able to get an adapter to keep all of my 18v tools alive with the new 20v batteries.
customer_reviews.author: RedAggie03

customer_reviews.title: a beast at driving screws
customer_reviews.text: Wow, never used an impact drill before. Have been using a regular Dewalt cordless drill to drive in screws. Holy cow, this impact drill is a beast at driving in screws-- really amazing for someone that has never used one. The brush-less functionality is cool. Wish i had bought this years ago. I bought dewalt because i already have the 20V dewalt batteries and you can't go wrong with dewalt.
customer_reviews.author: john d

customer_reviews.title: Great with impact ready attachments
customer_reviews.text: I mostly use it with impact ready attachments for construction purposes. It works out well for that purpose, I haven't actually used it as a wrench yet.
customer_reviews.author: GSM

customer_reviews.title: Really like the Dewalt tools and this set is exactly what ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazon was running this on Black Friday as part of a Dewalt DCD771C2 20V MAX Cordless Lithium-Ion 1/2 inch Compact Drill Driver Kit. Really like the Dewalt tools and this set is exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: R. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Stolen after 2 months,  but best drill i have ever used in construction for its size... hands down
customer_reviews.text: Best dewalt tool i have ever owned. Great power, light weight, functional. Probably why the thieves took this from our jobsite 2 months after purchase along with a 20/60 volt battery among other things. Even meth-heads will appreciate this drill because it will be easy to sell. Sad but true. A must purchase. Still need av replacement Dewalt. LOL. throw in a gps chip too...
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent performance, balance, and power.
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Powerful, balanced, predictable performance. Wish list: I wish there was a way to have it automatically stop so you don’t drive a fastener head through the material, like the adjustable clutch on a driver.
customer_reviews.author: William Lake

customer_reviews.title: Using everyday
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Been using it daily for several weeks. Works great and so much better than using a drill for driving screws.
customer_reviews.author: RobbyB

customer_reviews.title: Nice Power
customer_reviews.text: Have many of these cordless dewalt tools. Love them all. This one is awesome as well. Nice power... Will blast 4" screws into hardwood no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Joe K

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt is the best
customer_reviews.text: There’s no other tool like dewalt...I work in construction and have bought them all....I stick with dewalt because they last, the battery stays charged longer, they are faster, and just all around better
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box used it on my jeep changing out shocks. Worked terrific saved my knuckles. Great tool.
customer_reviews.author: STEPHEN GRIFFIN

customer_reviews.title: Another Exceeds Expectation
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Dewalt drill I purchased but the first impact drill. Both drills have performed flawlessly. Easy to use and allow me to get my repairs work completed quickly.
customer_reviews.author: J. Watts

customer_reviews.title: It’s a must have...
customer_reviews.text: Yes when you purchase any cordless tool w/o the battery they are a bargain. But alas they know you have to have batteries . They copied HPs printer success utilizing inflated prices on color cartridges. Buy it it blows my old18v away especially in ergo os and weight. I use the 5amp batts they last along time

product_meta.title: DEWALT 20V MAX XR Impact Driver, Brushless, 3-Speed, 1/4-Inch, Tool Only (DCF887B)
product_meta.description: Style:Impact DriverThe DEWALT DCF887B 20V MAX XR Li-ion Brushless 1/4" 3-Speed Impact Driver Bare tool features a DEWALT built brushless motor. This impact driver has 3-speed settings for optimized application versatility, along with Precision Drive in speed 1 for precision applications and added control. It offers three (3) LED lights with 20 second delay after trigger release to provide visibility without shadows. It also allows for one-handed loading 1/4" hex chuck with easy grip sleeve, and accepts 1" bit tips. This unit has a compact and lightweight design to fit into tight areas (2 mm shorter than the previous DCF886). Includes belt clip. This is a bare tool item - battery sold separately.
